pullRequest.title: Feature/exam mode/exam management
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Server: I added multiple integration tests (Spring) related to the features
 Server: I added @PreAuthorize and check the course groups for all new REST Calls (security)
 Server: I implemented the changes with a good performance and prevented too many database calls
 Server: I documented the Java code using JavaDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple integration tests (Jest) related to the features
 Client: I documented the TypeScript code using JSDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple screenshots/screencasts of my UI changes
 Client: I translated all the newly inserted strings into German and English

Motivation and Context
This PR creates the exam management view and the functionality to display exams for courses as well as delete exams. See #1618
Description
Created a view for the exam management and forwarded the appropriate requests to the server.
Within the scope of this PR are the listing of the exams and the ability to delete an exam from the server. For all other buttons, @sascha11110 's routes have been used but they link to 'TODO' sites or throw an error if there is no appropriate mapping yet.
Steps for Testing

Go to https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de
Log in to Artemis
Go to Course Management
Click on Exams
Create an Exam.
The Exam should now be visible if you are an admin/instructor
Delete a Course, it should be deleted from the server

Screenshots


Course Management



Exam Management



Delete Exam

commit.message: Add all html elements, add delete functionality
Move load and delete functionality to service
Connect the client to the server for delete and get requests

Add course as a field to access the isAtLeastInstructor flag
Also some linting

Add duration pipe to show duration of the exam correctly
The pipe handles differences of less than 24 and over 24 hours
Show 0 if there are no registered students instead of 'empty'

nodes.bodyText: Wouldn't be "Beginn" be a better naming? "Beginn" indicates a point in time whereas "Anfang" indicates more an area in time imo.

commit.message: add jest tests and gradlew spotlessApply

Update exam.json

Replace Anfang with Beginn

nodes.bodyText: More a question as an comment since I stumbled across it too: Do we need jhiOrionFilter and corresponding attributes for the exam management?

Exams

nodes.bodyText: HH:mm is used in ArtemisDatePipe so it would be good to be consistent here :-)
You are not using it so I think you can remove it. Also ArtemisDatePipe does not apply the format length to its time format so you will definitely not need it.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,31 @@
+import { Pipe, PipeTransform } from '@angular/core';
+import * as moment from 'moment';
+
+@Pipe({ name: 'durationTo' })
+export class DurationPipe implements PipeTransform {
+    /**
+     * Calculate the duration of an event from the diff of two dates.
+     * @param startDate The start date time of the event. Must be convertible to moment().
+     * @param endDate The end date time of the event. Must be convertible to moment().
+     * @param format Format of the localized date time. Defaults to 'long'.
+     * @returns string 'HH:mm'
+     */
+    transform(
+        startDate: Date | moment.Moment | string | number | null,
+        endDate: Date | moment.Moment | string | number | null,
+        format: 'short' | 'long' | 'short-date' | 'long-date' | 'time' = 'long',

nodes.bodyText: Again: do wee need OrionModule here?

commit.message:
Code Cleanup: artemis-duration.pipe.ts
- remove unused parameter
- remove console.log entries
- Show duration in format HH:mm for consistency
Merge branch 'feature/exam-mode/exam-management' of github.com:ls1intum/Artemis into feature/exam-mode/exam-management

nodes.bodyText:
I would like to keep this feature disabled on production for now. So we should keep this attribute.
You can set it to true for testing, but we should set it to false again before we deploy the new features to production
